question_text: What does fluency mainly refer to in IELTS Speaking?
options: ["Speaking very fast", "Speaking continuously without unnatural pauses", "Using difficult vocabulary", "Speaking loudly"]

question_text: Which word helps improve coherence?
options: ["Apple", "However", "Beautiful", "Quickly"]

question_text: Which sentence shows better fluency?
options: ["I like... um... my hometown... because... it is nice", "I like my hometown because it is a peaceful place with friendly people", "My hometown nice", "Hometown is good place"]

question_text: What is the most important aspect of pronunciation in IELTS?
options: ["Having a British accent", "Having an American accent", "Being clearly understood", "Speaking like a native"]

question_text: Which word has stress on the second syllable?
options: ["PHOtograph", "phoTOgraphy", "Both A and B", "Neither"]

question_text: What intonation pattern is used for yes/no questions?
options: ["Falling intonation", "Rising intonation", "Flat intonation", "No intonation"]

question_text: Which is a synonym for 'important'?
options: ["Big", "Crucial", "Fast", "Happy"]

question_text: What is the correct collocation?
options: ["Do a decision", "Make a decision", "Have a decision", "Take a decision"]

question_text: What does 'hit the books' mean?
options: ["Throw books", "Study hard", "Buy books", "Hate reading"]

question_text: Which sentence is grammatically complex?
options: ["I like coffee", "Although it was raining I went for a walk", "She is tall", "They run fast"]

question_text: Which tense is correct for experiences?
options: ["Past Simple", "Present Perfect", "Future Simple", "Present Continuous"]

question_text: What is the correct form?
options: ["He go to school", "He goes to school", "He going to school", "He gone to school"]

question_text: How long do you speak in Part 2?
options: ["30 seconds", "1-2 minutes", "5 minutes", "10 minutes"]

question_text: How much preparation time do you get in Part 2?
options: ["30 seconds", "1 minute", "2 minutes", "No preparation time"]

question_text: What should you write during preparation time?
options: ["Full sentences", "Keywords and notes", "Nothing", "The entire speech"]

question_text: How many words minimum for Task 1?
How many words minimum for Task 2?
Should you give your opinion in Task 1?
options: ["Yes always", "No only report what you see", "Sometimes", "Only in conclusion"]

question_text: What should every paragraph have?
options: ["Only examples", "Topic sentence supporting sentences and conclusion", "Just one sentence", "Random ideas"]

question_text: Which is a contrast linking word?
options: ["Furthermore", "However", "Therefore", "For example"]

question_text: How many linking words should you use per sentence maximum?
options: ["Five", "One", "Ten", "None"]

question_text: Which is more formal?
options: ["Kids", "Children", "Kiddos", "Youngsters"]

question_text: What should you avoid in academic writing?
options: ["Formal vocabulary", "Contractions like don't", "Complex sentences", "Examples"]

question_text: What is a paraphrase of 'increase'?
options: ["Decrease", "Rise", "Fall", "Stop"]

question_text: Which sentence shows variety?
options: ["I like cats I like dogs I like birds", "Although I like cats I prefer dogs because they are loyal", "Cats good", "I like cats"]

question_text: Which is an example of passive voice?
options: ["I collected the data", "The data was collected in 2020", "They collect data", "We are collecting data"]

question_text: What is a common article error?
options: ["Using 'the' correctly", "Writing 'I am student' instead of 'I am a student'", "Using 'a' before vowels", "All articles are correct"]

question_text: What structure is used for opinion essays?
options: ["No structure needed", "Introduction Body paragraphs with reasons Conclusion", "Only introduction", "Only conclusion"]

question_text: In discussion essays what must you do?
options: ["Only discuss one view", "Discuss both views and give your opinion", "Give no opinion", "Only give opinion"]

question_text: What should problem-solution essays include?
options: ["Only problems", "Only solutions", "Both problems and solutions", "Neither problems nor solutions"]

question_text: What should you listen for when names are spelled?
options: ["The meaning", "Letter-by-letter spelling and double letters", "The person's age", "Their address"]

question_text: How should you write phone numbers?
options: ["In words", "In digits as you hear them", "Don't write them", "In Roman numerals"]

question_text: What does 'double seven' mean?
What helps you predict content before listening?
options: ["The answer key", "Reading the context and understanding who is speaking", "Guessing randomly", "Nothing"]

question_text: What is the main idea?
options: ["Every small detail", "The overall point or topic", "The first word", "The last word"]

question_text: Where is the main idea often found?
options: ["In the middle of random sentences", "At the start repeated themes or summary statements", "Never mentioned", "Only in questions"]

question_text: What does 'opposite' mean in map directions?
options: ["Next to", "Directly across from", "Behind", "Inside"]

question_text: What should you do if you get lost during a map question?
options: ["Give up", "Skip ahead and catch the next landmark", "Stop listening", "Panic"]

question_text: What helps you track movements on a map?
options: ["Closing your eyes", "Drawing arrows and marking landmarks", "Memorizing everything", "Ignoring directions"]

question_text: What should you check before listening to note completion?
options: ["Nothing", "The word limit and type of word needed", "The weather", "Your phone"]

question_text: Should you change word forms in note completion?
options: ["Yes always", "No write exactly what you hear", "Sometimes", "Only verbs"]

question_text: What must completed sentences be?
options: ["Grammatically incorrect", "Grammatically correct and meaningful", "Very long", "Very short"]

question_text: When should you read multiple choice options?
options: ["After listening", "Before listening", "Never", "During listening only"]

question_text: What are distractors?
options: ["Correct answers", "Wrong answers designed to trick you", "Keywords", "Main ideas"]

question_text: What should you do if you miss a question?
options: ["Stop the test", "Guess and move on", "Leave it blank", "Cry"]

question_text: What is skimming?
options: ["Reading every word carefully", "Reading quickly to get the general idea", "Not reading at all", "Reading backwards"]

question_text: Where is the topic sentence usually located?
options: ["In the middle", "First or second sentence of a paragraph", "Last sentence only", "Never exists"]

question_text: What should you read when skimming?
options: ["Every single word", "Title headings first and last sentences", "Nothing", "Only pictures"]

question_text: What is scanning?
options: ["Reading everything slowly", "Searching for specific information quickly", "Memorizing the text", "Translating the text"]

question_text: What should you look for when scanning?
options: ["General ideas", "Capital letters numbers and keywords", "Grammar mistakes", "Beautiful sentences"]

question_text: Why are synonyms important in scanning?
options: ["They are not important", "The text uses paraphrases not exact words from questions", "They make reading harder", "They confuse you"]

question_text: What does 'True' mean in True/False/Not Given?
options: ["Your opinion agrees", "Statement matches or is clearly implied by the text", "Statement is interesting", "Statement is long"]

question_text: What does 'Not Given' mean?
options: ["The statement is false", "Information is not mentioned or insufficient to confirm", "The statement is true", "The statement is confusing"]

question_text: What is a common mistake in True/False/Not Given?
options: ["Reading carefully", "Using outside knowledge instead of only the text", "Following instructions", "Managing time well"]

question_text: What do headings represent?
options: ["Minor details", "The main idea of paragraphs", "Examples only", "Nothing important"]

question_text: Are there usually more headings than paragraphs?
options: ["No same number", "Yes some are distractors", "No fewer headings", "There are no headings"]

question_text: What should you focus on when matching headings?
options: ["Keywords only", "The overall message and main idea", "The first word", "The paragraph length"]

question_text: What must you check in summary completion?
options: ["Nothing", "Word limits and spelling", "Your opinion", "The time"]

question_text: Should you change word forms from the text?
options: ["Yes always", "No copy exactly as they appear", "Sometimes", "Only for verbs"]

question_text: What happens if you exceed the word limit?
options: ["Nothing", "Your answer is marked wrong", "You get bonus points", "The examiner is happy"]
